com.esri.mo2.ui.toc
Class LegendNode

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.ui.toc.LegendNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, MutableTreeNode, Serializable, TreeNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeatureLegendNode, GroupLegendNode, ImageLegendNode
public abstract class LegendNode
extends DefaultMutableTreeNode

A LegendNode is a non-leaf TreeNode in a Toc. It represents a corresponding Layer in a map. It is consisted of a checkbox and a label string. The checkbox is to set the visibility of the layer. The label represents the layer name.

The visual component presenting the LegendNode is stored in the user Object of the tree node.

See Also:
Serialized Form

refresh

public abstract void refresh()
The abstract method, it will be implemented by its sublcass. It will provide the necessary implementation to reconstruct the node.

getLabelComponent

public JLabel getLabelComponent()
A LegendNode is represented in the Toc by a inner class: LegendNodeComponent. It is a JPanel, that is consisted of two parts, a CheckBox(customized JComponent) and a Customized JLablel. The method will return the JLabel component part.

Returns:
true if the node is a child of root node.
